author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Bill Richardson Transport World to stir tourism boost for Southland, New ZealandTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Bill Richardson Transport World to stir tourism boost for Southland, New Zealand Published on : Thursday, August 27, 2015
One man’s passion has turned out to be profitable for an entire region. Bill Richardson Transport World, based in Invercargill, New Zealand, is likely to bring in tremendous tourism boost for Southland.
Bill Richardson Transport World is a private museum and is reputedly to be the largest private sector collection of its type in the world.
The museum could see 60,000 people a year visiting within the next decade, Venture Southland, agency responsible for the Southland regions economic and community development initiatives, says.
The existing museum, home to more than 300 vehicles and 150 petrol bowsers, already achieved 5000-6000 visitors per year organically, and Venture Southland estimated the new museum would reach at least 20,000 visitors in its first year.
The museum’s new art deco design features a cafe, shop, conference rooms and children’s playrooms.
Venture Southland tourism team leader Warrick Low said it would foster demand for more tourism opportunities in the south.
The museum is set to open to the public in October or November, with its first official event the hosting of the New Zealand Transport Hall of Fame on September 25.
Southland is New Zealand’s southernmost region and Invercargill is the southernmost and westernmost city in New Zealand, and one of the southernmost cities in the world. It is the commercial centre of the Southland region.
